data.title: Drum Workshop Inc.
data.text:
Nisan Stewart

BEYONCÉ / JAY Z / DANCING WITH THE STARS

Nisan Stewart is a musician, born and raised in Inglewood California. He has been operating professionally in the music industry as a Music Director, producer, song writer, and musician for many years. His first professional hiring as a musician was by former MCA Records A&R executive Randy Jackson, with Puff Johnson. Shortly after that Nisan connected with Grammy Award winning super producer, Timbaland. From that point he began his song-writing and producing career. He has been nominated for a Grammy, received ASCAP awards, and many others. His producing and writing credits includes artists such as Beyonce’, Nelly Furtado, Missy Elliott, Janet Jackson, P. Diddy, MaryMary, Busta Rhymes, Patti LaBelle., Tweet, and many more.

Throughout his producing career, Nisan maintained his love for the stage and live performances. He has a love for developing the live performances from beginning to end. Nisan currently is the drummer for the hit TV show Dancing With The Stars. Some of his recent TV credits also include the the Emmys, house band for the MTV Awards, BET Awards house band, and BET Comic View’s One Mic Stand featuring Kevin Hart. Nisan has been the Music Director and/or touring drummer for Jay Z, P. Diddy, Beyonce, TGT, Patti LaBelle, El DeBarge, Jessie J, NAS, Chris Brown, Jessie McCartney, Busta Rhymes, Leona Lewis, Tweet, 50 Cent, Marcus Miller, Flo-Rida, T.I., The Dream, Lady Gaga, etc. He currently is the Music Director/Drummer for Jamie Foxx, Nelly, Brandy, Tamar Braxton, and Nicole Sherzinger. He continues to push the artists’ creative buttons to make their songs and performances come to life through live music.

On DWe: "I love the ability to change my drum sounds at the click of a button, from vintage to modern...just like that!It just feels natural. My game has just elevated with DWe."

Stephen Perkins

JANE'S ADDICTION / PORNO FOR PYROS

Born in Los Angeles, Perkins’ picked up drumsticks at the age of eight. His first public drum performance was at his Bar Mitzvah1980 in front of family and friends. His passion for playing the drums led him to purchase his first drum set bought at Valley Arts Music Center, Studio City, CA with his Bar Mitzvah gift money.

In 1983, his first band "Champion" played the Troubadour in Los Angeles; his second band "Disaster" rocked the Whiskey and the Roxy in Los Angeles in 1984. By late summer 1985, Perkins joined an older singer and bass player and together they formed Jane’s Addiction. Jane’s Addiction released their first record "Live At The Roxy" on Triple X Records, which led to signing a seven-record deal with Warner Bros. releasing "Nothing Shocking" (1988), which was nominated for a Grammy.

In 1990 "Ritual De La Habitual" was nominated for two Grammy’s and Jane’s Addiction went on to headline the first Lollapalooza tour that summer. Perkins joined the band "Infectious Groves" in 1991 and recorded in toured for two years. By 1993, Perkins created Porno For Pyro’s and released its first self-titled album on Warner Bros. Records, which was nominated for a Grammy. He went on to release several more records with Porno For Pyro’s, released an instrumental jazz-fusion record with Banyan on Higher Octave Record Label.

Perkins reunited with Jane’s Addiction with Flea on bass in 1997, while also releasing a second Banyan record. By 1999, he released the third Banyan record while joining Tommy Lee for the Methods of Mayhem tour. He went to tour with Methods of Mayhem and record for two years. In 2001, Jane’s Addiction released "Strays" on Capital Records. For the next five Perkins was busy touring and recording and started yet another new band called "Panic Channel" - Capital Records.

Perkins became a proud papa to his son and continued working with Jane’s Addiction, Hellride, Tabitha, Summer Moon (w/ bass player from The Strokes), and Drop The Needle, a new lounge jazz-funk band. Watching Perkins on drums is a show within itself. His energy, charisma, unique skill and style make him one of the most sought after drummers today.

He received his star on Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1997, and Hands at the Rock Walk Hall of fame at Guitar Center Los Angeles.

The 1st time I sat behind the DWE drum set, I closed my eyes and rocked out with full force. Hitting the drums , vibrating the shells, cracking on the rims and moving a lot of air. It’s real!

On DWe:

"The simple power and ease of having 10,12,14,16” toms, 20 or 22 kick drums & real snare drum targets feels so familiar but somehow brand new because yours hearing pure clean dynamic samples.Then, what do you know? The drum set is convertible to actual acoustic drums. You add in the fact that there’s no cables or cords connected, and you've got yourself a great sounding, high-powered jaw dropping electronic drum set...it has sound and vision."

Patty Anne Miller

QUINN XCII / CEELO GREEN / LESLIE ODOM JR. / ZARA LARSSON

If poetry in motion were defined by a single artist it would surely be Patty Anne Miller. A triple threat in the creative space, Patty is an incandescent star. Not only does she march to the beat of her own drum, she designs those beats. As a drummer, actress and all around entertainer, Patty is an unforgettable force. She vibrates at a frequency that is unmatched and illuminates any arena she steps into. Upon meeting Patty, most immediately sense that she was born to entertain.

Inspired by Sheila E., Patty began her electrified love affair with drums in church at the age of ten. Influenced by Aaron Spears, she infused gospel chops into a hard-hitting rock style. Patty discovered fusion at a young age, quickly becoming the perfect blend of Dave Weckl, Tony Royster Jr. and Travis Barker. As a full-tuition scholarship recipient, she graduated from Berklee College of Music in 2010.

Determined to pursue her dreams, Patty quit her full time retail job to go on tour with a rock artist. Although the tour proved to be fruitless, she viewed it as a teachable moment, and resolved to grow from the experience. Having no quit in her, she threw herself full force into her music career and started networking and playing local gigs. Patty’s hard work and persistence paid off in dividends when she was chosen to tour with Ceelo Green. From playing with Beyonce during halftime at the Super Bowl, to being featured in national television commercials for McDonalds and Chobani yogurt, to touring the world with Quinn XCII, performing alongside artists such as Leslie Odom, Zara Larsson, Daya, Melody Thornton and more, Patty’s star has only begun to rise.

She recently made her feature film debut in a major studio sequel, “Bill and Ted Face the Music,” which premiered August 28th 2020. Getting a taste of the set life, left Patty hungry for more. Unwilling to be immobilized, she quickly realized it was time to elevate her career and goals to a dimension worthy of her talents. Through it all, Patty has remained focused on one thing; to use her many gifts and carry out her purpose. More than a musician, more than an actor, Patty is an entertainer blazing her path to new heights.

Terry Bozzio

INDEPENDENT

Born in San Francisco, California, Terry Bozzio began playing drums at a young age and quickly developed a passion for music. He gained recognition in the 1970s as a member of the progressive rock band Frank Zappa and the Mothers of Invention, where he showcased his virtuosic drumming abilities. Bozzio's drumming style is characterized by intricate rhythms, complex time signatures, and his innovative use of multiple drums and percussion instruments.

He is also an acclaimed instructor and author, having delveoped ostinato based solo drum compositions and releasing instructional videos Melodic Drumming & the Ostinato vols.1, 2, & 3. Throughout his career, he has collaborated with numerous renowned musicians and bands, including Missing Persons, Jeff Beck, Andy Taylor, Robbie Robertson, Gary Wright, Don Dokken, XYZ, Paul Hyde, Herbie Hancock, Dweezil Zappa, Richard Marx and UK.

Bozzio's technical prowess and creative approach to drumming have earned him several awards, including induction into the Modern Drummer “Hall of Fame”, Mondern Drummer “Clinician of the Year” (twice), Drum Magazine “Drummer of the Year” and “Best Clinician” (twice) , Schlagwerkrant Magazine (Holland) “Best Drummer” award and Player Magazine (Japan) “Best Drummer”.

He is also included in Modern Drummer’s “Top 25 Drummers of All Time” and has handprints cemented in the RockWalk of Fame in Hollywood.

On DWe:“The most promising thing I’ve seen in electronic drums.”

John "JR" Robinson

INDEPENDENT

John was born in Creston, Iowa on December 29, 1954. He's the son of the late optometrist, Dr. Jack Robinson and the late Helen Sloan. Both parents, through music, had a strong effect on John. He started on piano at the age of 5 and on drums at the age of 8. John turned pro when he started his first band at the young age of 10. John received the Arion Award in high school for most outstanding musician then attended Berklee College of Music in Boston. In 1978 John got his break joining the band Rufus and Chaka Khan winning his first Grammy with the hit record, "Ain't Nobody". JR has become the most recorded drummer in history playing on 500,000,000 records sold.

On DWe:

"This is not only a tool in my toolbelt but it's going to be a very valuable product for the future, for my career, and for thousands and thousands of percussionist.”

Roy Mayorga

MINISTRY

Roy Mayorga has left an indelible mark on the music scene. From his primal and powerful playing style developed through childhood days of banging on pots and pans, to immersing himself in the influences of drumming icons like John Bonham and Neil Peart, Mayorga forged his own unique musical path.

His journey began in the punk scene with Nausea, leading to stints with Shelter and Crisis. But it was his collaboration with Max Cavalera on Soulfly's debut that propelled him onto the global stage, touring extensively and leaving an imprint on the metal world.

Joining Stone Sour in 2006 marked a significant shift, with Mayorga becoming an integral part of the band's explosive success. Contributing not just on drums but also in songwriting and production, he played a pivotal role in albums like "Come What(ever) May," "Audio Secrecy," "House of Gold & Bones Parts 1 & 2," and "Hydrograd," earning platinum status and establishing Stone Sour as a force in hard rock.

His versatility extends beyond drums; Mayorga's proficiency spans guitar, keyboards, and songwriting, showcasing his intuitive energy across multiple instruments. His talents also branch into production, engineering, and composing for film and TV.

During breaks from Stone Sour, Mayorga lent his skills to "Hellyeah," supporting their album "Welcome Home" and honoring the memory of drummer Vinnie Paul. Roy has been Ministry's on and off touring drummer since 2016 and also has recorded on their 2018 release (AMERIKKKANT).

On DWe:

"These are wireless. I don't have to think. I can just get there, express myself, and not worry about anything."

Jess Bowen

THE SUMMER SET / LIGHTS / JAX / TESSA VIOLET / ALICE GLASS / 3OH!3

Jess Bowen is best known as the drummer of the The Summer Set, a pop-rock band she co-founded as a teen in Arizona in 2007. Having garnered a local following with their early work, the band was signed to their first record label as soon as the members graduated from high school, and they went on to gain a large international fan base. The Summer Set has several well-received albums under their belt, and have toured all around the world, including performances in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, iHeart Radio Music Festival, and several summer's on Warped tour. They have had multiple songs featured on radio and a variety of television shows on ABC and MTV. As of 2021 the band reunited and have continued touring around the world. On top of touring with her own band, Jess also plays with artists such as 3OH!3, Lights, Jax, Alice Glass, Tessa Violet, The Ready Set, and many others. She's also been featured in a national Pepsi commercial as the drummer for Charli XCX. Most recently, Jess was featured in a documentary on Netflix called "Count Me In" alongside other drumming legends like Chad Smith of the Red Hot Chili Peppers, Roger Taylor of Queen, Stewart Copeland of the Police, and many others. She is known to audiences around the world for the energy she brings to the stage and the life her drumming infuses into the music.

On DWe:

"No cables. It's just like... the cleanest looking kit. You walk in, and again, it just looks like an acoustic kit there."

Matty Brown

STORMZY/ SUGARBABES/ ELLIE GOULDING - DRUMMER/ MUSICAL DIRECTOR/ PRODUCER

Matty Brown, from Hackney in London, was named Young Drummer of the Year 2013 when he was sixteen years old. He has been playing drums as long as he can remember: "I have a very strong musical background from my grandparents and my parents. I learnt how to play in church but try my best to go deeper into drumming. I listen to a wide range of music and I try to keep busy playing gigs and other events." Matty's drumming career began at the age of 1 when his parents decided to buy his first drum kit after they noticed his enthusiasm to hit things in a rhythmic manner (often during dinner time with eating utensils causing a big mess). Fortunate enough to have been mentored and inspired by his Dad and Uncle (two heavyweights in the UK Music industry), Matty was destined for major success! Practicing day and night to turn that natural rhythmic banging into powerful well-drilled rudiments, it's no surprise that Matty quickly became an integral part of his church band. By the age of 16 he had been able to nurture his craft and build enough skill and confidence in his playing to win the renowned Young Drummer of the Year competition (YDOTY) 2013. He then appeared at the London Drum Show opening for Jojo Mayer, and describes it as an honor to be invited back to now be doing his own set in recognition for his continuous hard work.

In the time elapsed between YDOTY 2013 and now, Matty has been fortunate enough to share both domestic and international stages with the likes of Stormzy, Plan B, Wretch 32, Soul 2 Soul, Little Mix, J Huss, Lady Leshurr, Lion Babe, Kojo Funds and Candi Staton at some of the most illustrious arenas, stages, TV shows and award ceremonies.y

David Lucius King

SONGWRITER/ PRODUCER

David Lucius King is a songwriter, producer, artist, and multi-instrumentalist based in the legendary Metropolis Recording Studios in London. David started his musical journey at the young age of 14 when he signed his first major record deal with EMI records. In 2011 he was picked up by Universal Music L.A. and continued to hone his writing and producing talents in Malibu, California where he stayed with his aunty/pop diva superstar, Cher.

Six years later he decided it was time to move to London, where he met Jamie and Ross at Whole Ent, and he started his career in the UK working as a Producer/Songwriter. Only after a few months, David’s work had drawn attention from most major labels. They started flying major artists in from around the world to work with him. A year on and he was already working with Irish rock band, The Script on their album ‘Sunsets & Full moons which charted Number 1 in UK & Ireland in November 2019. He developed a long-standing relationship with the band and wrote and produced the singles titled ‘Run Through Walls’, ‘Hurt People Hurt People’ & ‘Love Yourself’. He is still working closely with them on their forthcoming releases.

David Lucius also has a keen A&R mind with his finger on the pulse and always looking for the stars of the future. He in known in the record industry for discovering singer/songwriters, working with them and getting them signed to some of the largest record labels in the UK.

Nick Tsang

GUITARIST/ SONGWRITER/ PRODUCER

Nick Tsang is one of the world's finest new talents to come into the music scene; a fresh and passionate player who is receiving rave reviews and recommendations from top industry musicians, MDs and producers. Since turning professional in 2004, Nick has toured internationally, amassing a wealth of live and recording credits with the likes of The Backstreet Boys, Ed Sheeran and Busted.

​

In between live touring, Nick works as a songwriter and producer. As well as releases with his original project 'Amberlake', Nick has writing credits with AlunaGeorge, Modestep, and Jess Glynne where he co-written the single 'Take Me Home' from her No.1 album 'I Cry When I Laugh'. 'Take Me Home' was the charity single for 'Children In Need 2016' and has sold over 1,200,000 copies and has over 300 million streams online.
